definition: priority/sth advocated first/refers to ancient tradition: Worship the river first, then the sea.

sentences.english: We can say that it is Zhaozhou Bridge that marks the advent of the open-spandrel bridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们完全可以说，赶州桥首开了敞肩拱式桥型的先河。

sentences.english: Machiavelli, you might say, cleared the brush.
sentences.chinese: 马基雅维利开创了先河。

sentences.english: Undoubtedly, open educational resources have given higher education unprecedented reach.
sentences.chinese: 毫无疑问，开放教育资源开创了高等教育的先河。

sentences.english: Hakka people once played a positive role in the woodcut movement.
sentences.chinese: 就全国的木刻运动而言，客家人在诸多方面开了先河。

sentences.english: The hippies ③started out as young Americans who were opposed to the Vietnam War.
sentences.chinese: 反对越战的美国青年开了嬉皮文化的先河。

sentences.english: This is the "Zen tea blindly" thinking precedent.
sentences.chinese: 这便是“茶禅一味”思想的先河。

sentences.english: China symbolism poem party was the beginning of Chinese modernism, which could had obtained the larger literature achievements.
sentences.chinese: 中国象征诗派开中国现代主义诗歌的先河。

sentences.english: He is commonly considered the first of the realists in Renaissance art.
sentences.chinese: 他被公认是文艺复兴艺术中现实主义的开先河者。

sentences.english: Mission poems can be regarded as the beginning of mission poems of Southern Song Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他们的使金诗作可以说开南宋使金文学之先河。

sentences.english: Is Oregon's metropolis a leader among American cities or just strange?
sentences.chinese: 俄勒冈重镇是领美国城市之先河，或者仅是个特例？

sentences.english: A Chinese wall of money will be on its way, once the Blackstone precedent has been set.
sentences.chinese: 一旦从黑石开先河，一道中国金钱的围墙将竖立起来。

sentences.english: The situation comedy is going to start soon. Just switch to channel one.
sentences.chinese: 气象笑剧从速就要先河了，快调到一频道。

sentences.english: The establishment of Foochow Shipbuilding Istitution was the first milestone of the education for modern coast denfence.
sentences.chinese: 福州船政学堂的创办开近代海防教育之先河。

sentences.english: Arthur Mervyn initiates the tradition of urban gothic fiction.
sentences.chinese: 莫文》开创了城市哥特小说的先河。

sentences.english: Theyhave ever been working on this project since last year.
sentences.chinese: 他们从去年先河不绝都在做这个项目。

sentences.english: GXUN was the first institution of higher education to apply this pattern in the field of the non-common language majors in China.
sentences.chinese: 这一模式在全国非通用语本科专业中首开先河。

definition: to create/original creation/to be the first to do sth
the earliest ancestor/originator (of a tradition, school of thought etc)
lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
lit. floating wine goblets on a stream/the origin (of some phenomenon)
one and only (idiom); rarely seen/unique of its kind
